comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: William Gibbs McAdoo, secretary of the treasury under Woodrow Wilson, and his second wife, Eleanor Randolph Wilson, daughter of the President. They got married on 7 May 1914. She actually looks much better in a formal portrait (now at the LOC Harris & Ewing collection):

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The McAdoos were visiting the Princeton University campus on June 13, 1914, in the company of Mrs. McAdoo's father, U. S. President Thomas Woodrow Wilson, who was attending the 35th anniversary reunion of his Princeton graduating class, the Class of 1879: "President is just 'Tommy' for a day" --New York Times story, June 14, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F7091FF73C5E13...
